questions.question_text:
A customer has decided to use VMware Workspace ONE as their primary SAAS solution for endpoint management. The customer's security team requires all infrastructure to support High Availability (HA).
Which two components of Workspace ONE will need to be maintained by the customer? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
For SaaS deployments, only ACC and UAG need to be maintained.

Selected Answer: AD
SaaS, So Only ACC & UAG

https://techzone.vmware.com/resource/workspace-one-uem-architecture#on-premises-architecture


The implementation is separated into the three main components:

Workspace ONE UEM Admin Console
Workspace ONE UEM Device Services
AirWatch Cloud Connector

comments.content: That is On-Premises UEM architecture. The question asks for SaaS. So A&D are the correct answers.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
SaaS deployments would have the console, device and database services in the "cloud" - A company will still have to maintain the Connector and Unified Access Gateway services to reach the companies own network.

comments.content: On a SaaS deployment, Device Services are cloud based.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AE
https://techzone.vmware.com/resource/workspace-one-uem-architecture#scalability

choices.D: Configure a VPN Profile for VMware Tunnel Proxy.
choices.B: Configure Tunnel for VMware Tunnel Proxy in the SDK settings.
choices.A: Configure Tunnel for VMware Tunnel in the SDK settings.
choices.C: Configure a VPN Profile for VMware Tunnel.

discussion.content:
Answer A,
Keyword in this one is IOS devices.
“Stand-alone” tunnel is (for now) not for IOS devices.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM/services/Tunnel_Linux/GUID-AWT-TUNNEL-KEYCONCEPTS.html#setting-up-a-load-balancer-for-backend-tunnel-servers-7

Selected Answer: A
VMware Web cannot be based on classic profiles nor on the VMware Tunnel application which needs system control. You therefore go through the WS1 SDK to push the configuration directly into the application without going through the system. And it's not the B because the Proxy Tunnel is end of life.

questions.question_text:
A company has BYOD iOS devices and would like to give them access to internal sites in VMware Web without requiring full device management.
Which VMware best practice configuration is needed to enable this?

discussion.content: Is ABD, from manual of WS1 course.

Selected Answer: ABD
ABD That is all

ABC
The Content Gateway provides a secure and effective method for end users to access internal repositories. Using Content Gateway with VMware Workspace ONE® Content (formerly Content Locker) provides levels of access to your corporate content. End users can remotely access their documentation, financial documents, board books, and more, directly from content repositories or internal file shares. As files are added or updated within your existing content repository, the changes immediately display in Workspace ONE Content. Users are granted access to their approved files and folders based on the existing access control lists defined in your internal repository.

Workspace ONE Content not only provides access to on-premises content repositories, but also enables users to have access to multiple cloud repositories.

Selected Answer: ABD
Can't check external repositories

Selected Answer: ABD
A, B, D - 

Why in the world would email or health have anything to do with this? :)

ABD - 
A. Encrypted communications using SSL/TLS. Most Voted
The default port for Content Gateway is 443 as TLS Port Sharing is enabled by default on Unified Access Gateway. When TLS Port Sharing is disabled, Content Gateway listens on port 10443.
These ports are secured with a public third-party SSL certificate, which includes the subject name of the server host name.

B. Secure access to internal repositories. Most Voted
The Content Gateway provides a secure and effective method for end users to access internal repositories.

D. Support for most corporate file servers. Most Voted
Workspace ONE UEM supports integration with various corporate file servers. The syncing method support and requirement of the Content Gateway component vary by repository type.

Selected Answer: ABD
ABD is right

Selected Answer: ABD
CG has nothing to do with exchange. And it doesn't provide health status of remote repo.

Selected Answer: ABD
Using the link below, I think ABD are more appropriate answers.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM/services/WS1_Content_Gateway.pdf

questions.question_text: Which three are features of the Workspace ONE Content Gateway service? (Choose three.)

choices.C: Provides health status on external repositories.
choices.E: Provides email notification for Exchange mail.
choices.D: Support for most corporate file servers.
